intro: Zexmenia salvinii, commonly known as the Mexican moonflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often have a velvety texture. Zexmenia salvinii thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value.
